name: Winfield Scott Commemoration
obverse: Bust of Winfield Scott facing left. To the left and right of the bust are stars.
reverse: Depiction of seven different battle scenes from the Mexican-American war. Six of the battle scenes are encircled in wreaths around the central scene.
reverse_inscriptions: C. C. WRIGHT FT.
references: The Medallic History of the United States of America, 1776-1876, Volume 1 #62
description: This massive medal was made to commemorate General Winfield Scott's contributions in the Mexican-American War.
This medal is considered by some to be C. C. Wright's masterpiece and one of the most impressive US Military medals.
The obverse was designed by Salathiel Ellis. The reverse was designed by G. C. Humphries. The Latin inscription 'DEL.' means 'delineavit'.
